result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Mitchell Volenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $518 Paid in Full from Bond Posted
Must Obtain Full Time Employment and/or schooling
Maintain Absolute Sobriety, including no possession of any controlled substances unless prescribed by physician
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessments and DOC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Mitchell Volenberg

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Defendant completed Substance Abuse Program

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

December 15, 2016   Sentencing
Forfeit Bond to Echo

Defendant Adam Mitchell Volenberg in court in custody with attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders: 6 years WSPrison, 10 years Extended Supervision; Conditions: Maintain Absolute Sobriety, including no possession of any controlled substances unless prescribed by physician; Complete AODA; Full Time Employment and/or schooling; Court costs and DOC Supervision fees paid in full. Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessments and DOC; 0 days credit; Deft IS ELIGIBLE for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program; Bond to be applied to all Costs and in 2016CF880 and Balance to be sent to ECHO, Janesville WI.
